direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods return items from the stack without removing them, but 'peek(int)' allows specifying the depth.
Both methods interact with the top item of the stack, but 'pop()' removes the item while 'peek()' does not.
Both methods modify the stack, but 'push(E)' adds an item to the top while 'peek()' retrieves without modifying.
Both methods involve searching or accessing elements in the stack, but 'search(Object)' returns the position while 'peek()' returns the element.
Both methods handle the stack being empty, but 'empty()' checks for emptiness while 'peek()' throws an exception if empty.
